onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorE.Description: Called when there is a new sensor event. Note that "on changed" is somewhat of a misnomer, as this will also be called if we have a new reading from a sensor with the exact same sensor values (but a newer timestamp). See @B_android#hardware#SensorManager_E@ for details on possible sensor types. See also @B_android#hardware#SensorEvent_E@. @B_android#hardware#SensorEvent_E@ object passed as a parameter and therefore cannot hold on to it. The object may be part of an internal pool and may be reused by the framework.

Parameters: int: The new accuracy of this sensor, one of SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_*
onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Senso.Description: Called when the accuracy of the registered sensor has changed. Unlike onSensorChanged(), this is only called when this accuracy value changes. See the SENSOR_STATUS_* constants in @B_android#hardware#SensorManager_E@ for details.
onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Senso.FullName: public abstract void onAccuracyChanged (Sensor sensor, int accuracy)

Parameters: int: The new accuracy of this sensor, one of SensorManager.SENSOR_STATUS_*
onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Senso.Description: Called when the accuracy of the registered sensor has changed. Unlike onSensorChanged(), this is only called when this accuracy value changes. See the SENSOR_STATUS_* constants in @B_android#hardware#SensorManager_E@ for details.
onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Senso.FullName: public abstract void onAccuracyChanged (Sensor sensor, int accuracy)

ClassDesc: Used for receiving notifications from the SensorManager when there is new sensor data.
